channel.title: 639 server help
channel.description: how do I use the item command on a 639 source and client I try to use basic command with the console but nothing is fucking working somone plesase help me

item.title: 639 server help
item.dc:creator: @tomato721 tomato721
item.description:
@tomato721 wrote:

[quote=“wildskiller, post:8, topic:444461”]Aha! I was trying to think of what it was. All I could remember was parse intI can’t remember too much about java but I will try to put together an item command

if (command[0].equals("item")) { int itemId; int amount = Integer.parseInt(command[1]); if (command.length == 2) { player.getInventory().addItem(itemId, 1); } else if (command.length == 3) { player.getInventory().addItem(itemId, amount); } }

Took a long ass time to make because my tablet has a fucked up keyboard

I’m a big fan of teacher people what the code means. I hate to explain it to you because I’m bad with the whole teaching situation, and I don’t use big words like most of the Java Gurus on here.

So here I go…
Basically command.length is getting the length of the command, and all arrays start out at 0 which is basically the first part of the command. This is used for mainly arrays, if there isn’t anything else it’s used for. So using Integer.parseInt(command[1]);, which is built into the system, lets you use the second part of the command because of command[1].

Here is an example of what the command will look like with the length of only 2 which will obviously give only 1 item because you’re not finishing the command with the lenght of 3.

It will give the player the amount they want when using length 3 because of the Integer.parseInt(). You can set a variable using this to make it easy for you like I did with int amount.[/quote]

i love the way u actually help ne noobs and not call them leechers or stupid because
i believe that if people actually help eachother moparscape would be a better place anyways im a big fan of u and i would pre but i dont haf rep cuz im new too i support u against X1xreaverX1x btw

keep up the good work
btw i think there are no rocktail fishing
anyways i love ur source

Read full topic

if (command[0].equals("item")) { int itemId; int amount = Integer.parseInt(command[1]); if (command.length == 2) { player.getInventory().addItem(itemId, 1); } else if (command.length == 3) { player.getInventory().addItem(itemId, amount); } }

Took a long ass time to make because my tablet has a fucked up keyboard

I’m a big fan of teacher people what the code means. I hate to explain it to you because I’m bad with the whole teaching situation, and I don’t use big words like most of the Java Gurus on here.

So here I go…
Basically command.length is getting the length of the command, and all arrays start out at 0 which is basically the first part of the command. This is used for mainly arrays, if there isn’t anything else it’s used for. So using Integer.parseInt(command[1]);, which is built into the system, lets you use the second part of the command because of command[1].

Here is an example of what the command will look like with the length of only 2 which will obviously give only 1 item because you’re not finishing the command with the lenght of 3.

It will give the player the amount they want when using length 3 because of the Integer.parseInt(). You can set a variable using this to make it easy for you like I did with int amount.[/quote]

cant u just give me you .java file i dont care if i loose all my data because i havent done anything yet i got school

item.title: 639 server help
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

Aha! I was trying to think of what it was. All I could remember was parse intI can’t remember too much about java but I will try to put together an item command

if (command[0].equals("item")) { int itemId; int amount = Integer.parseInt(command[1]); if (command.length == 2) { player.getInventory().addItem(itemId, 1); } else if (command.length == 3) { player.getInventory().addItem(itemId, amount); } }

Took a long ass time to make because my tablet has a fucked up keyboard

I’m a big fan of teacher people what the code means. I hate to explain it to you because I’m bad with the whole teaching situation, and I don’t use big words like most of the Java Gurus on here.

So here I go…
Basically command.length is getting the length of the command, and all arrays start out at 0 which is basically the first part of the command. This is used for mainly arrays, if there isn’t anything else it’s used for. So using Integer.parseInt(command[1]);, which is built into the system, lets you use the second part of the command because of command[1].

Here is an example of what the command will look like with the length of only 2 which will obviously give only 1 item because you’re not finishing the command with the lenght of 3.

It will give the player the amount they want when using length 3 because of the Integer.parseInt(). You can set a variable using this to make it easy for you like I did with int amount.

in the commands did u add ur username to if (player.getUsername().equalsIgnoreCase("tomato721") || player.getUsername().equalsIgnoreCase("urname") || player.getUsername().equalsIgnoreCase("more names") || player.getUsername().equalsIgnoreCase("ur name") || player.getUsername().equalsIgnoreCase("more names") || player.getUsername().equalsIgnoreCase("more names")) { adminCommands(player, command);

ohh and its not working cuz of the error u said… well u haf to see which :line: they are talking abbou in

and delete that line

item.title: 639 server help
item.dc:creator: @lol0 lol0
item.description:
@lol0 wrote:

[quote=“tomato721, post:5, topic:444461”][quote author=lol0 link=topic=547151.msg4011978#msg4011978 date=1339291314]

it depends on which source ur useing and to see if they added an item command just go to commands.java
and search “item” with the “” if there is u might not be an admin or they put and restriction that you must have your username as a specifit username to spawn like mine(quantum)

I have quantom aswell but im just wondering how do I make myself admin or take the restrictions off of it Im kinda new to coding a 639 server.
[/quote]

Oh in that case u go to ur server files and search commands.java then press Ctrl then f. And search “wild” then change all of them to ur username after u do that do ::giverank ur username then 2. Gl :d[/quote]

1 more question when i compile i get these errors for no reason could u give me your file if you have fixed these errors IMP/SPECS/aimedshot.java
descent of dragons.java
phantomstrike.java

if you have fixed these errors would you kindly be able to upload them for me?
oh and it doesent work it keeps saying use i tried using console and it doesn’t work still i tried ::giverank xxxxxx 2 and giverank xxxx 2 xxxxx=uknown name

thanks lol0

Read full topic

item.description:
@tomato721 wrote:

[quote=“lol0, post:3, topic:444461”][quote author=tomato721 link=topic=547151.msg4011264#msg4011264 date=1339240184]
it depends on which source ur useing and to see if they added an item command just go to commands.java
and search “item” with the “” if there is u might not be an admin or they put and restriction that you must have your username as a specifit username to spawn like mine(quantum)
[/quote]

I have quantom aswell but im just wondering how do I make myself admin or take the restrictions off of it Im kinda new to coding a 639 server.[/quote]

Oh in that case u go to ur server files and search commands.java then press Ctrl then f. And search “wild” then change all of them to ur username after u do that do ::giverank ur username then 2. Gl :d
